problem_statement: The core engineering failure in asynchronous firmware control is
between long-running effects (animations) and immediate overrides. A common mid-tier mistake is implementing

goroutines; if a user triggers a 5-second fade and then immediately sets a static color, the old fade goroutine continues running in the background, overwriting the new state and causing the lights to flicker or revert (Ghosting). The solution requires a robust synchronization primitive such as a revocable Context, a Generation Count (Epoch), or a Command Channel to ensuring that only the authoritative (latest) command has write access to the shared hardware buffer while simultaneously applying non-linear Gamma logic.
